name: NewYorker
text: The history of Tecumseh, a Shawnee leader who pursued a Native confederacy, reveals the foundational sins of what we now call the American Midwest. https://t.co/cVAGl5kXyl

name: NewYorker
text:
For the sociologist Max Weber, only the most heroic figures could generate meaning in the world. Does his theory hold up today?

name: NewYorker
text:
Ordinary citizens, awakened from complacency by Donald Trump, may be our best hope for rekindling an American identity that brings us closer to the ideal of one nation, indivisible.
